title: Data Analysis: Alcohol vs. Tobacco Sales
question_text: Created for Albert.io. Copyright 2017. All rights reserved. Consider the scatterplot above. Which point is the most influential, and in what way is this point influential?

choices.text: The point ( 4.0 , 4.6 ) ( 4.0 , 4.6 ) is most influential because it decreases the correlation and increases the slope.
The point ( 4.0 , 4.6 ) ( 4.0 , 4.6 ) is most influential because it decreases the correlation and decreases the slope.
The point ( 6.2 , 4.5 ) ( 6.2 , 4.5 ) is most influential because it increases the slope and decreases the correlation.
The point ( 6.2 , 4.5 ) ( 6.2 , 4.5 ) is most influential because it increases the slope and increases the correlation.
None of the points on the scatterplot appear overly influential.
